definition: to decline/to wane/to become weak or feeble

sentences.english: They all age a hundred without decline in motion because of their perfect upright virtue.
sentences.chinese: 所以能年皆度百歲而動作不衰者，以其德全不危也。

sentences.english: Having boomed for so long, Florida's economy is now ailing.
sentences.chinese: 佛羅里達州經濟長盛不衰，如今卻也難逃厄運。

sentences.english: But despite a change in content, MTV continues to thrive.
sentences.chinese: 然而儘管在內容方面變了，MTV仍然長盛不衰。

sentences.english: He trains every day with his passion.
sentences.chinese: 每天臨池不輟，激情不衰。

sentences.english: Third, set off firecrackers and the customs temporary enduring a tradition.
sentences.chinese: 第三，放鞭炮也是我國習俗傍邊經久不衰的一項傳統。

sentences.english: To be ordinary makes us happy; this is the key to its constant popularity.
sentences.chinese: 平庸使我們快樂，這是它長盛不衰的主要祕密。

sentences.english: And that's a perennial issue in philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 這在哲學上也是一個經久不衰的問題。

sentences.english: But now, your comedy can live on forever.
sentences.chinese: 但是現在，你的喜劇能夠經久不衰。

sentences.english: "Sherlock Holmes" is the world's ever-popular classics.
sentences.chinese: 《福爾摩斯探案集》是全世界暢銷不衰的經典名著。

sentences.english: The"charm"is the widely known cause for Guan Hanqing s Gongan dramas.
sentences.chinese: “魅力”是關漢卿公案劇盛傳不衰的主要原因。

sentences.english: For if it prosper, none dare call it treason.
sentences.chinese: 因爲長盛不衰就沒有人敢稱之爲叛逆。

sentences.english: It is not difficult to find the reasons for their enduring appeal.
sentences.chinese: 找到其吸引力能經久不衰的原因並不難。

sentences.english: Only by focusing on the whole experience and daring to break out of its own mold will Facebook maintain momentum and growth.
sentences.chinese: 只有專注於整體體驗並勇於突破自我才能長盛不衰。

sentences.english: Why do Chinese people hold memorial ceremonies for them every year?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼中國人對黃帝聲勢浩大的祭典歷久不衰？

sentences.english: It has been one of the most enduring genres in the business.
sentences.chinese: 這是影視業中最經久不衰的類型之一。

sentences.english: The novels written by "Poems on Red Leaf" in the Tang & Five Dynasties have long enjoyed popularity since their emergence.
sentences.chinese: 唐五代“紅葉題詩”小說自它產生之日起便盛傳不衰。

definition: passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
to grow and multiply without end
from generation to generation/generation after generation
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
to become known far and wide (idiom)/famous
to make a name/to become famous
